posts.body:
>>a1160162-e966-4c0c-afcd-b31394dc6fe2
>can't register an Millchan certificate
A Millchan certificate will be created for you if you make a post without having a certificate on [Millchan](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA).

>it don't give me a private key
Not sure how you accomplished that.
If you clone this hub ZeroNet will create a new empty hub for you and your private key will be in the data/users.json file.

>>f29ea696-4598-4f96-9e97-2572e1dd01b8
Because a hub will not necessarily accept @millchan certificates.
A hub owner might configure their hubs to only accept @zeroid or some other CA.

Generating Millchan certificates in those cases here would make no sense.

>>1bbb7de1-fa35-4353-ba6e-97bfdc06bca1
>Only editing .json files in text editors?
At the moment, yes.

>>9f426d3d-444a-4181-ba95-19231eb9066d
No. In the original Millchan the only person who can sign other people's json files is the zite owner.
